CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 12, 1965, pg. 15, reads: "KEY PARTICIPANTS AT CENTRAL WOMEN'S DAY - The success of the recent Women's Day observance at Central Baptist Church was keyed by the Rev. Sandy Ray (left), pastor of Cornerstone Baptist Church, Brooklyn, N. Y., shown exchanging ideas with the host pastor, the Rev. Isaac Green. Women of the church who participated at the morning worship hour are (continuing left to right) Mmes, Charles P. Pernell, W. Augustus Jones, F. E. McNairy, Jacob Williams, Rahmot Ghafoor and Edward E. Jones.  A full day of activity included the afternoon service, which presented Mrs. W. D. Petett as speaker. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of six women wearing light colored outfits, left to right: Mrs. Charles P. Pernell, Mrs. W. Augustus Jones, Mrs. F. E. McNairy, Mrs. Jacob Williams, Mrs. Rahmot Ghafoor, and Mrs. Edward E. Jones, with another woman singing at podium at right, for Women's Day at Central Baptist Church
